==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab}}

===Etymology 1===
Compound of {{compound|汝|tr1=namu|t1=you|達|tr2=tachi|pos2=plural suffix|lang=ja}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|[namutatɕi]|lang=ja}}

====Pronoun====
{{ja-pos|pronoun|なむたち}}

# second person plural pronoun; [[you]], [[ye]], [[you guys]]

===Etymology 2===
/namutati/ > /namtati/ > /namdati/. From earlier {{m|ja|汝達|tr=namutachi}}. See {{m|ja|汝達|tr=nandachi}}. The medial /m/ was written as /mu/ before the /n/ character evolved, but the effects are visible in the voiced /d/.

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|[namdatɕi]|lang=ja}}

====Pronoun====
{{ja-pos|pronoun|なむだち}}

# second person plural pronoun; [[you]], [[ye]], [[you guys]]
#* {{RQ:Konkōmyō Saishōōkyō Ongi|6 (back)}}
#*: 汝等 '''なむたち'''
#* {{RQ:Konkōmyō Saishōōkyō Ongi|10 (front)}}
#*: 仁等 '''なむたち'''

===Etymology 3===
/namdati/ > /nandati/. From earlier {{m|ja|汝達|tr=namdachi}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|[nandatɕi]|lang=ja}}

====Pronoun====
{{ja-pos|pronoun|なんだち}}

# second person plural pronoun; [[you]], [[ye]], [[you guys]]
